Fields.DialogueText: Good morning, Captain.
Busy with those reports, Lieutenant?
... What a chaotic few days it's been.

Fields.MenuText: Don't tell me you're getting too old for this.
It has... but it's why we do what we do, right?
I will admit, I enjoy the thrill.

Fields.DialogueText: Very funny. To be honest, I almost want to say yes, but my pride isn't letting me.
Part of the job description, I suppose.
This admission implies it is quite an acquired taste, but we don't really have a choice.
Stay strong. Let me know if anything comes up.
*ALARM*
Captain? Something came up.
Exactly. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Quite. Who knew catching a couple of spies could inspire so much...
Well, be grateful nobody's blaming you for the policies that let them onboard in the first place.
Yeah, I've been hearing rumours. I trust you're not actually going to be marched off the ship in darbies?
I'm mounting the traditional paperwork campaign. I'll be fine.
And the spies themselves?

Fields.MenuText: Safely in the hands of the INPF.
We handed them over to the authorities at Wilhelmshaven.

Fields.DialogueText: Poor blighters.

Fields.MenuText: Hans picked out a nice desert island for them.

Fields.DialogueText: Probably for the best.
Did we then shell the island?
Surprisingly, no.
I'll get you the documentation if you need to add the details to your report.
You're in charge. Do I?
Yep.
Just thought I'd ask.
Paperwork?
I was going to say "bog roll."
Damn it!
What are you so upset about, Hans?
I just hate it when I forget a specific detail that I had meant to put in my journal.
You, forgetting a detail? You're always so meticulous about writing everything down.
No need to get angry. Whatever it was you forgot, do you remember what it was related to?
Not exactly. Well, actually, it might have been related to Admiral Stein.
About the speech that you'll be giving?
That's it! I had a witty and clever opening statement in mind, but I forgot what it was.

Fields.MenuText: Give it time. It'll come back to you.

Fields.DialogueText: No time for views and air! I must come up with a speech to impress the admiral.
*ALARM*
Looks like you're going to have to take that view break one way or another.
Damn it.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: A shame. It was probably really good.
You'll come up with something better, I'm sure.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope you're right about that.
How about you go enjoy some fresh air? We might have some good weather today.
It was. I'm sure of it. Hmph!
Let's hope so.
I'm confident you'll do great. If I can help out, just ask. I'll make time for you, Hans.
Oh? I... I appreciate that, Kapitän. I'd actually enjoy spending some-
Well, how was that break?
You mean combat? Too tediously familiar, if you must know.
*ALARM*
Don't say anything!
@BATTLE
That last battle was unsatisfactory. Despite our victory, I sensed the crew was sluggish. Are they not awake today?
We are somewhat short on personnel, Hans. These Morgana battles are sending more than a few sailors to the sick bay.

Fields.MenuText: Hans is right, though. Even with a shortage of able crewmembers, we still need to focus.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll have a talk with the crew, then.
Or else I will talk to them! I know they wouldn't want that.
I'll go out on a limb and say you're completely right about that, ma'am.
Want another one?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe if they stayed alert, they wouldn't get wounded.
Nothing we can do about that.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah...
I see.
Of course, Captain.
Nurse Emi? How are the wounded down here?
Ah! Glad to see you visiting, Captain. Our wounded are doing better, but their recovery cannot be accelerated.
That's a pity.
Captain, with these battles occurring so frequently, have you considered requesting reinforcements? Additional personnel could be useful.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you for giving me the opportunity to brag.

Fields.DialogueText: So... fingers crossed.
Thanks, Captain. We could really use the help.
Well, then. Let's hope we get those reinforcements. Apparently everyone else here has decided to opt out of hard work.
Are you serious? Have a little sympathy, Hans. They're wounded.
*ALARM*
Let's try not to send any more customers to Nurse Emi today, Hans.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Good idea.
Well, aren't you so smart? Gee, what else am I failing to think of around here?

Fields.DialogueText: Actually, I sent a request for additional personnel earlier today. That includes an assistant nurse to help you with your work.
Kapitän?
Do not act so juvenile, Kapitän. We have no room for children on this ship.
You think so? Thanks!
Aye, Kapitän.
Glad you made it for this meeting on time.
Why wouldn't I? I made a note of it in my book. Besides, I wouldn't mind some time together. So what is it?
It appears the admiral has granted our request for more crew, but he will also be sending an advisor with them.
Advisor?
Kapitäleutnant Doris Pagenkopf.
Never heard of her.
You wouldn't have. She's part of a new wave of recruits and advisors of the admiral. Trust me - she's a tough character.
She better not get in my way.

Fields.MenuText: Relax, Hans. I don't want you two fighting. This is purely business protocol.

Fields.DialogueText: Protocol? Sure... Right...
The admiral wants a survey and full report of our operations. He doesn't want us wasting resources or crew.
So he's sending a little pea counter to review me?! How insulting.
Again, don't start any fights with Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf. She'd fight back.
*ALARM*
That little tart better not get in my business. That's all I'm saying.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Jealous? Interesting...
I wouldn't let her.

Fields.DialogueText: What?! That's not... Hmph!
I don't need you to fight my battles for me.
Why would there need to be a battle? Relax.
You know her?
It's been a while since we've seen each other, and our situations are obviously... very different now. But, yes.
Hello, Hans. This is a treat. I rarely see you here on the outer deck by yourself.
Enjoying the view? My beauty is hard to ignore. Anyway, why are you here?

Fields.MenuText: I am a little worried about you. Don't tell me I'm not allowed to feel that way.
Just wanted to check on you. Are you feeling okay? You look stressed.
Penny for your thoughts?

Fields.DialogueText: You can feel whatever it is you feel. Just don't expect me to be nice.
Is that your way of saying my complexion is bad? Tread carefully, Kapitän.
Ocean. Waves. That's about all a penny is worth.
Enough with the patronizing. Don't we have better things to do with our time?
Suit yourself. Before I go I thought you would like to have this.
What is it?
An old journal that my mother gave me. I hardly use it. Since you write so much, I thought you could make better use of it.
Speechless? It won't hurt my feelings if you don't want it. I'll be off now.
@BATTLE
Ouch. So I guess dinner and a bottle of wine is off the table?
Not at all. You look great as always.
Guess you're not in a conversational mood.  Please accept my apology.
Danke...
I suppose that since there isn't much to do here, I should write down how I'm feeling in this journal. So how am I feeling?
*ALARM*
"Annoyed." Easy first entry.
@BATTLE
What are you doing here in my quarters, Hans? I thought you were in the mess hall eating.
I'll eat later. I'm just looking through all our data entries and battle logs - it's your own fault for bringing them down here.
Anyway. Give me five minutes and I can have these reports and entries sent to your room.
Nein, danke. I'm fine right here.
But I'm tired and want to sleep. Please, just take the files and go.
Fine! But before I go out, can I ask you something?
Very well, what is it?
Have you heard of Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf?
Sure. The captain was chuffed to get her onboard - I think they knew each other before the war.
How close were they?
Just friends, I think. Wait, are you jealous?
What!? Are you implying that I'm that weak and prone to such emotions?!
You are shouting, so maybe.
Don't push me, lieutenant.
Is that my diary over there!? Were you going through it to find dirt on Pagenkopf and the captain?
Are you insinuating that I'm a sneak? Of course I wasn't.
Look, Hans, it is getting late and I really need my sleep. If you insist on staying here, then just be quiet. Better yet, take the files you need and leave.
By the way, my diary is off limits.
Fine by me. It was a dull read anyway.
Why does everybody have to act so strangely on my ship?
Everything all right in here? I thought I heard some shouting.
Oh. Hello, Kapitän. Just checking up on a few trivial... affairs. Need anything?
Affairs?

Fields.MenuText: I must have interrupted something private. I'll be going.
What's going on here?

Fields.DialogueText: He's fine, Kapitän. Everything here is fine.

Fields.MenuText: You look pale, Lieutenant Edwards. Need to see Nurse Emi?

Fields.DialogueText: I assure you, you've missed nothing, Kapitän.
Good question. Is there something... going on?
Can everybody just leave my room? I want to sleep!
Yeah, what was I thinking, trying to get more work done at the end of the day?
Sorry, Hans, there isn't much food left. You're kind of late.
Chef Bruno, what are you saying? There's no more food?!
I did save you some desserts, ma'am.
Excellent! Now give it here.
Here you go... Wow. Not even a thank you?
Chef, your services are appreciated.

Fields.MenuText: That counts as a thank you in her world, Chef. Take what you can get.

Fields.DialogueText: Enjoy your evening, you two.
I wasn't expecting to see you here. Are you all right?
I'm fine. Just thinking about the advisor that Admiral Stein is sending over.
Don't worry about her. As long as we do our job well, it will be fine.
How optimistic. You seem awfully excited to have her around.
Having another person going around scrutinizing everything we do? Why, yes. I'm thrilled beyond consolation.
Don't get funny on me, Kapitän. This is serious business. She has the power to mark me as a disreputable Belle if she doesn't find things to her liking.
That could ruin my reputation and my standing as a good servant of Germany.
That won't happen, Hans. Trust me.
*ALARM*
I will trust but verify. Come on, Kapitän. Let's get to the bridge.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Besides, it's your job.
She'll be more considerate next time, Chef.

Fields.DialogueText: So... calling her a spoiled brat would be jumping the gun? Guess I'll wait for next time, Captain.
That's fair to say... even though I don't like it.
I see.
Is everything ready for Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf's arrival tomorrow, Captain?
As ready as it can be, although I must admit, I wish the ship was in better shape.
I'm sure Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf will be lenient. Besides, the ship isn't that bad, considering all the fighting we've been doing.
I suppose you're right.
I assume you've spoken with Hans recently? She's been acting very strange lately.
She's just very worried that Pagenkopf will give her a bad review.
She was snooping around in my room the other day, and even read my diary.
Really? Do you know what she was looking for?
This might sound odd, but hear me out, Captain. I think she was looking for information about you and Pagenkopf.
Preposterous. What on earth is she looking for?
Rumors, facts, gossip, and anything else that might define your relationship with Pagenkopf a bit better.
But why your diary?
I'm your right hand on this ship, and - call me presumptuous - I do think of you as a friend. It's not unreasonable of her to think I'd have information on you.
At the risk of being even more presumptuous - I think she might be developing feelings for you, Captain.
Really?
Look... it's not really my business to judge you or her on these matters, but I do hope that things will remain professional.
They will.
So do you have feelings for Hans?

Fields.MenuText: It's still too early to tell, but we have shared a few close moments.

Fields.DialogueText: The one your mother gave you? So you DO have feelings for the girl.
Pagenkopf and I are friends.
I... see.
*ALARM*
Anyway, let's make this a quick fight. We need time to prepare for tomorrow.
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I'd rather not get into that.
I'm smitten!

Fields.DialogueText: That settles it. You obviously do!
Settles that, I guess!
I gave her my journal the other day.
And Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf?

Fields.MenuText: You're presumptuous.

Fields.DialogueText: Noted.

Fields.MenuText: Information that you'd write in your diary, though? I don't see what she's getting at.
You can't just glide past the "friends" thing. Should we hug?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Let's not.

Fields.MenuText: It's been a very long time since we even thought about being anything else.
And she owes me money, though I doubt I'll ever get it back.
And this has turned into a very strange conversation, hasn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a very strange war.
Truer words may never have been spoken.
Ah. I see.
I'm glad you decided to come out here with me to welcome Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf aboard.
How could I not? I am just DYING to meet this woman.
Sarcasm?
Ugh!
There's her barque now. Let's go greet her.
Tell me, is your heart fluttering right now?

Fields.MenuText: What on earth are you talking about, Hans? My heart does not flutter.

Fields.DialogueText: I was afraid of that...
Good day, Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf. I trust your trip here was to your liking?
Nice to see you... Kapitän. Yes, my trip here was fine. Some choppy waters, but nothing too serious.
I'm Hans Lody, the Belle of the ship. Just don't get too comfortable while you're here.
A pleasure. I've heard impressive things about you.
In any case, I shall be off now.
You'll have to excuse her. She can be somewhat abrupt, but very loyal once you earn her trust.
I see. So where to next?
Let me show you to your room. It's not very luxurious, but you'll find all the amenities you need are there.
Thank you... Kapitän.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: A little. I haven't seen my friend in a long time.
Only because you're standing so close to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't tease me, Kapitän.
Your heart flutters for friends? You're stranger than I thought, Kapitän.
You too. Excuse me...
*ALARM*
You're having too much fun with that word.
I know, I know. It's nice seeing you again after such a long time.
Who invited her to the bridge?
She needs to conduct her inspections, Hans.
What do you need, Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf?
I'm here to observe the daily routines and schedules of all the staff at the bridge.
Just be quiet and don't bother anyone, then.
Excuse me...
I said you can stay, but don't get in the way of daily operations. We can't have you interfering with operations and manipulating results.
I see. Very well.
Psst! Hans! You know the captain won't tolerate you treating Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf like that...
Are you worried Pagenkopf will be offended?
What do you have against her, anyway?
I don't like anyone undermining my talents or skills, especially someone like her.
Let's change the subject before tempers really flare.
I don't have a temper problem.
If you say so, ma'am. By the way, why aren't you using the journal the captain gave you?
You know about that!?
I'm told it's a treasured possession.
All right, I'm here. Sorry for the delay. Did I miss anyth-- What's with that gloomy look, Hans?
*ALARM*
All right, everyone, let's get to work on these Morganas. Give it your all in this fight.
@BATTLE
Journal, second entry. "Pagenkopf's arrival has irritated me greatly. Ironically, it has also given me a new incentive to display my value. I hope the captain will--"
*ALARM*
I may not finish that.
@BATTLE
How did we do during that last battle, Kapitäleutnant?
The crew and leadership did very well, I must say. No casualties to speak of.
Good. Does that mean your stay with us will be over soon?
Not exactly. I am tasked with staying here until Admiral Stein's visit.
What? That long?!

Fields.MenuText: Hans, please do not be so rude. Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf is only doing her job and following the admiral's orders.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine, then. Do you want me to leave so you two can catch up?
No, you're needed here.
In that case, I'm leaving.
I really don't think Hans wants me here on board. Did I do something wrong to deserve this kind of attitude from her?
She just needs time to warm up to you. After that whole spying debacle, she's... more cautious of visitors.
I see. Perhaps I should go talk to her.
Suit yourself, Pagenkopf, but don't expect too much.

Fields.MenuText: That seems excessive.
If that's what the admiral wants.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph.
It seems just as ridiculous as anything else on this ship.
Hello, Hans. Enjoying your meal there?
So Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf DOES visit the mess hall. I didn't think you were too fond of food, considering your shape.
I'll pretend I didn't hear that.
So what exactly are you reporting to the admiral, anyway?
Nothing dramatic. I'm just documenting the context for your logs and reports.
So just busywork.
Didn't think I'd see you two here.
I'll be leaving now.
Hans, no. Please stay. Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf, can you give us some space?
Sure, Captain. You know where to find me.

Fields.MenuText: What did she do to you?
Do you realize you're being unfair to Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf?
I sense you feel threatened by Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf, Hans.

Fields.DialogueText: I just don't like her. Straight and simple.
I am not being unfair to her. She is the one here treading upon my work and my operations.
Why would I feel threatened?!  She can't very well harm the spirit of a ship!
Why are you even here?
I was just passing by. I wanted to talk to you about Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf.
Because she's so important to you?
I heard she was promoted only because her uncle bribed the admiral.
Try not to go around spreading rumors, all right? We need to keep morale high and gossip low.
*ALARM*
Duty calls, Kapitän. Bye.
@BATTLE
Harsh. While I respect your stance, you still need to keep it professional here.
She's merely doing her job observing the ship and reporting it back to the admiral. It's nothing personal.
Forget I asked. Perhaps I misread you.
I'm pretty sure her only living uncle is a butcher.
Hans, I'm glad you came to me as soon as you did upon discovering an enemy plan to attack Admiral Stein.
We must increase security and be more responsive.
I suggest we have an entire crew briefing on security. Everyone needs to be at their best.
First thing tomorrow, I will lead everyone through the protocols.
Will Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf be there for this?
She will be. She needs to observe how we handle important security protocol.
If you say so...
I know we sort of touched on this topic last time, but I've been meaning to ask you why you dislike her so much.
I told you, she impugns and undermines my intelligence. The very fact that she is here scrutinizing my abilities and the ship's operations is insulting.

Fields.MenuText: She was told to come here by the admiral. Wouldn't you follow direct orders yourself?

Fields.DialogueText: Ugh, fine. You just love taking her side, don't you?
I am not taking anyone's side, Hans.
I understand having her aboard is adding an extra element of stress to our operations, but it shouldn't deter us from enjoying each other's company.
What are you talking about?
This is very awkward, but there was a reason I gave you that journal.
What is it?
*ALARM*
Come see me after this, and I'll try and explain myself to you.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: It wasn't her idea to come here.
Her observations might actually help us.

Fields.DialogueText: I doubt that.
It's still a bad idea, no matter who is responsible for it.
If they were really stupid orders, I would have to question them.
Do I want to write another journal entry? Sigh...
*ALARM*
I guess that answers my question.
@BATTLE
Listen, everyone! I want a full report of all damage and casualties sustained during the battle.
What are you all standing around for? Get to it!
Aye-aye, Captain.
Edwards, I want you to draft up the after-action report. Get it to me as soon as possible.
Yes, Captain. I'm on it.
Hans, can you hear me?
I hear you just fine, Kapitän... I am just... collecting my thoughts. And my breath.
A bit winded, perhaps... but our Belle seems fine, Captain.
Nurse Emi?

Fields.MenuText: How bad is it?
Are you sure she's fine? Hans is awfully quiet.
I don't claim to be an expert in the biology of supernatural women who are also ships, so please explain how this works.

Fields.DialogueText: Our proud Schiffsdame should be fine after a little bit of rest, Captain.
Not too bad, Captain.
For my purposes, I assess and treat Belles essentially the same as a normal woman. Only... they're a lot tougher!
Times like this really make me wish we could get that request approved. The one for additional personnel.
I'll manage.
Pagenkopf, could I trouble you to get some kind of answer from the admiral or someone else on top?
Of course. I'll see if I can get someone on the radio.
Thank you.
Nurse, should we get Hans to sick bay?
Not much room in there right now. Maybe just some bed rest. I can check on her later.
Really? Thank you.
No problem.
Thank you, nurse.
As I said. I am fine.
Yes, Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf? Do you need any assistance?
Over... overreacting, Kapitän. I don't need...
Kapitän, I have good news, finally.
What is it? Has my request for reinforcements been granted?
It has.
Excellent! Thank you for your help, Pagenkopf. I needed some good news around here.
It gets better.
How so?
You didn't ask for very much in your request, you know. I talked the Admiral into adding some extra crew, ammo, and stores to the requisition.
Thanks... Thanks, Pagenkopf.
Hans will be happy to hear about it. Well, she'll pretend to be angry about it, complain about how long it took... but I'll know how she feels.
You have feelings for her, don't you?

Fields.MenuText: I hate to admit it, but yes. I do.

Fields.DialogueText: Why would you hate to admit something like that? Are you worried your pride will take a hit if she finds out?
As long as it doesn't interfere with your work, you should confront her with these feelings.
Edwards told me the same thing. Keep it professional, he said.
He's right, too.
So... what will you do now?
Back to the main fleet? Resume your duties with Admiral Stein?
That's right. I'll be packing up soon. Hey, see you later, Kapitän.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Maybe...
I do. I really do.

Fields.DialogueText: Glad to hear it. She's great... in her way.
Quit pretending!
Take care of yourself, Doris.
*ALARM*
... It still feels really strange calling you that, you know.

Fields.MenuText: Don't think I'm not enjoying your discomfort.
It still feels really strange seeing you in a uniform.
Ah, you can always use the old insults in private.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I'm sure.
At least it's spectacularly tailored.
You know... I don't think I can. You've become too respectable.
Weird.
I know.
I am pleased to see how well you have healed, but be honest. How do you feel?
Barely conscious? I'd better not ask anything strenuous of you.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hello, Hans. How are you?
Nurse Emi is overzealous. I am fine.

Fields.MenuText: I see.

Fields.DialogueText: Hans, please rest if you feel any fatigue. There's no need to strain yourself.
Nurse, there are urgent things that need my attention. Let me go.
She's right, Hans. Maybe get a little rest, and I'll have the chef bring up anything you'd like to eat?
Actually, I am a little hungry.
Go and get her some food, Captain. I'll monitor her while you're out.

Fields.MenuText: How about some bratwurst, Hans?
Let me guess, Hans. Desserts all the way?
Drinks for you both?

Fields.DialogueText: Sure, but have the chef bring up some Puddingbrezeln with it.
You read my mind. I think Puddingbrezeln will be good.
Only if it comes with sweets.
I'll get right to it, then.
Same here.
No... no.. I'm fine. Quit poking me with needles! I need to get to the bridge!

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure?
Could've fooled me. You look like hell.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose I should let you go. I have other patients with more serious needs.
*ALARM*
SEE?
@BATTLE
It's nice seeing you two out here on the deck.
She won't leave me alone, Kapitän. It hurts.
No, it's the fact that the ship is operating without my full guidance. Who knows what we let happen while I rested?
There have been no problems, Hans.
Hello, everyone. Hans, good to see you out and about.
Still mad at me for unknown, mysterious reasons?
Heh...
I'll... take that as a yes.
Pagenkopf, I thought you left already this morning.
I was supposed to, but at the last moment I got a radio message saying that the Admiral wanted me here.

Fields.MenuText: Is that a good thing?

Fields.DialogueText: The Admiral is also transferring his other officers and aides away to other ships.
I need to get on the radio with Erich Steinbrinck immediately.
Understood. Kapitäleutnant Pagenkopf, please assist Lieutenant Edwards. He'll be preparing for the onload of our reinforcements.
Certainly, Kapitän.
Not a moment too soon!
You still have pain?

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't mind you staying a little longer.
What's that supposed to mean? Is something wrong?

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph. I'll bet you wouldn't, Kapitän.
Not sure, Kapitän.
Not sure, Kapitän.
Hans, do you have a moment?
For you? Nein. Highly unlikely.
Truly? What is your excuse?!
*ALARM*
THERE's a good excuse.
@BATTLE
What are you doing here again? I didn't give you permission to enter.
Tough luck, because I'm already in here.
What is it you want, then? Make it quick and leave!
I won't leave until you tell me why you're being such a pain to me.
That's what this is about? My time is reserved for serious work only.
Like gossiping about me to the crew and telling everyone I'm just a glorified secretary?
Because you ARE.
Look, if you won't say it, I will. You've been a pain to me because you're jealous and threatened.
That's... preposterous!
It's apt and the truth, because I read about it in your journal. You know, the one the Kapitän gave you?
You left it sitting out in the open, and I peeked.
You little sneak! I will see to it that you are punished for looking through classified material!
You're just as guilty! I know you've broken into my room before to read my diary.

Fields.MenuText: What's with all the yelling in here?

Fields.DialogueText: Tell your girlfriend she needs to stop snooping around or else!
First of all I am not anyone's girlfriend. Second, you're acting like a child.
She's right, Hans. Pagenkopf is not my girlfriend, because I have no feelings for her. You, on the other hand, I DO have feelings for.
I know...
Then why are you acting so unruly towards Pagenkopf?
She felt threatened, and you keeping your feelings all bottled up didn't help the situation, Kapitän.
Well, it seems you two have a lot to talk about, so I'll leave now.
What do you say, Hans? Do you think we can be more than just shipmates?
I'll have to think about it. Right now, there are more pressing matters to tend to.
Suit yourself. I'll be waiting for an answer.

Fields.MenuText: Can you start all of the shouting over from the beginning? I want to make sure I didn't miss anything.
Should I come back later, or do you need a referee?

Fields.DialogueText: Very funny...
Finally!
Very funny...

Fields.MenuText: You're right.
Oh, don't look so smug.

Fields.DialogueText: She's as good as new, captain.
Thank you, Nurse Emi. I could have told you just as much.
No matter what Hans may say, we both appreciate all your work and care.
It's my job, Captain! And not many nurses can say they have worked with a Belle.
You two enjoy the day now.
I have pressing issues to address with you.
Ready to get back to work. Now that's the Hans I know and love.
A shining exemplar of Belle dedication? I concur.
Speaking of Belles, I spoke with Erich Steinbrinck, and we have discovered grave news.
What is it?
The main fleet's personnel are a bit scattered right now.
All of the personnel reassignments have left a few gaps in key positions. In all of the shuffle, the admiral's ship might be vulnerable.
I see. People always try to make do, but sometimes it's not enough.
We should make way to Admiral Stein.

Fields.MenuText: You really think he's in danger?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't believe that our enemy will miss this window of opportunity. We must leave now.
What about our reinforcements? We're supposed to meet them at this location.
I'm afraid those "reinforcements" might just be a ruse to delay us. While we wait here, we're unable to defend the admiral...
Damn! That makes sense...
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Admiral Stein can take care of himself.
Why is that our problem?

Fields.DialogueText: Not just him. That's a flagship, Kapitän. Think of all those sailors.
I wouldn't be so sure.
The admiral is critical to the effort, Kapitän. That vulnerability represents a problem for all of us.
Put the pieces together, Kapitän.
*ALARM*
Hard at work preparing the feast, Chef Bruno?
Indeed I am, Kapitän! Come to the galley and take a look!
*ALARM*
It'll have to wait... but thanks for putting this together!
I'll have it ready when you get back, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
What's going on here? We're making a critical transit to protect the admiral, but for some reason... a party?
We'll arrive when we arrive... but in the meantime, why not? Perfect occasion for a special meal to celebrate your recovery!
Just sit, Hans.
Where is the Kapitän?
Right behind you.
Ach! Puddingbrezeln! Kapitän, did you really-

Fields.MenuText: I knew you'd like it.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose I should thank you all - even you, Pagenkopf - for taking the time to prepare me a wonderful meal.
Ha! This is the nicest she's ever been!
True. You hardly ever say thank you, Hans.
Keep sailing that course, and I'll never say it again! Hmph!
And there she goes, back to her old self...
All right everyone. We've got work ahead of us, but for now... let's enjoy.
Everybody is making far too much of my VERY temporary condition, from which I have recovered fully. In fact, I--

Fields.MenuText: I put in some hard work helping Chef Bruno, but that smile on your face was worth it.
Nothing's too good for my Belle.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh... are you trying to make me blush in front of everybody? It... it won't work... *blush*
Oh... Danke, Kapitän. And Chef Bruno, too.
Not many people can surprise me like this, Kapitän...
I'll drink to that, Captain.
Nice job on taking down those Morgana ships.
No need to patronize me, Kapitän! I assure you, I'm feeling fine... but I appreciate your concern. Thank you.
How certain are you that there is an attack planned for the admiral's ship?
You trust your instincts, don't you? I can just feel it. All the evidence points to an attack, once you think about it.
Why would the admiral spread out his resources and ships? Put himself at risk like that?
Perhaps someone is convincing him to do it. Maybe his second in command?
Commander Haas?
Maybe. Or this could all just be a coincidence. For the first time in my life, I hope I am wrong.

Fields.MenuText: Hans, have you thought about what I said? About my feelings for you? I don't want to wait too long to discuss it.
How do you feel about what I said the other day? Can we talk about that?
Remember that past conversation, with you and Pagenkopf? I wasn't just trying to break up a fight. I truly do have feelings for you, Hans.

Fields.DialogueText: This is hardly the time, Kapitän, to be speaking of such things.
I'm... still processing it. Maybe later.
But it was PARTIALLY you trying to get me to stop harassing Pagenkopf, right?  Still, we can speak more of this another time.
Fair enough. Now's not the time.
*ALARM*
Look over there, Hans. See it? Morgana ships converging the admiral's position!
We can intercept that one group before they reach him. Let's strike hard and remove them from the fight!
@BATTLE
We'll find out when we arrive. So...
Still no success contacting the admiral on the radio, Captain. No one in the admiral's fleet is answering up.
Looks like Hans might be right about this situation.
We did a good job taking down those ships in the last battle, but we might be too late overall.
We have to assist as much as we can, Captain. That might make the difference...
The admiral's ship does have ample firepower. If they can hold off the enemy while we move in, then we can give them a fighting chance.
I can hear it.

Fields.MenuText: Get a few extra turns out of our engines, Hans. Get us there faster.

Fields.DialogueText: Looks like a mess up ahead, but we'll be part of the mess soon.
Do you think that-
Enough talking! Let's fight!
@BATTLE
I don't know how good your ears are, Kapitän - but I'm sure I hear gunfire. They're still in the fight.

Fields.MenuText: It's not too late. We're going to take some of that heat off the admiral.
You were right, Hans. About all of it.

Fields.DialogueText: Pushing as hard as I can, Kapitän.
That's the idea, Kapitän.
I wish I'd been wrong...
Nice work! We're still afloat. Push reports to damage control, and get our gun crews ready for more.
I'm ready for more, Kapitän. Time to push for the Morganas that are surrounding Admiral Stein's ship.
That's where the ugliest ones are...
Let's hope no one has made it aboard the admiral's ship yet.

Fields.MenuText: We'll take care of this.
Any other help coming, Hans?
Do you feel ready to take that ship on, Hans?

Fields.DialogueText: Agreed. We won't let them take the admiral's ship.
I can't guarantee that my sisters will arrive in time. This one is up to us.
It is my duty to the Fatherland. Ja, I am ready.
*ALARM*
All right, one more battle!
@BATTLE
Hans, how are you holding up?
Did you transmit our acknowledgment to the admiral?
I did. In addition to thanking us with a meritorious citation, he gave us another gift. Dismissal. He's released us from the formation.
We're free to go our own way, then. You were spectacular, Hans.
Ja, I was, wasn't I? That combat was chaotic, but a wonderful rush... just like you.
Like me?
Can't talk all of a sudden?

Fields.MenuText: So I am... chaotic and wonderful?
Does this mean you and I are...?
So do you finally have an answer about what we are?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, and an idiot. A wonderful idiot. My idiot.
Yes, yes, yes! Officially consider me your girlfriend. Ach, what a juvenile word for such a thing... but I suppose it will do.
Yes, and to make sure you don't forget, I have something for you.
I like that.
Now let's just be quiet and enjoy the sunset.
We've earned some R&R, haven't we? I'm looking forward to some time off. Together.
I'll take it.
Come a little closer for your reward, Kapitän. *kiss*
We have certainly earned a break. A break - maybe with Puddingbrezel?
Not a bad idea, Hans...
